definitions.definition: To tangle up ; to twist or interweave in such a manner as not to be easily separated.
examples: The dolphins became entangled in a fishing net.

definitions.definition: To involve in such complications as to render extrication difficult.
To involve in difficulties or embarrassments ; to embarrass , puzzle , or distract by adverse or perplexing circumstances, interests, demands, etc.; to hamper ; to bewilder .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To tangle up ; to twist or interweave in such a manner as not to be easily separated.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To involve in such complications as to render extrication difficult.
( transitive ) To involve in difficulties or embarrassments ; to embarrass , puzzle , or distract by adverse or perplexing circumstances, interests, demands, etc.; to hamper ; to bewilder .
